newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - FileNet downgraded. [CORRECTED 16:06 GMT]
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - FileNet downgraded. [CORRECTED 16:06 GMT]

text.p: -- Robertson & Stephens Co analyst Paul Dravis (corrects from Paul Davis) said in a research note that he lowered his recommendation on FileNet Corp to market performer from long-term attractive.
-- After Thursday's market close, FileNet said it expects fourth quarter revenues to be about $73 million versus $67.7 million one year ago and earnings of $0.20 per share compared th $0.32.
-- The Robertson Stephens estimates for the quarter were $79.5 million in revenue and $0.51 per share in earnings.

-- "The company has stated that results were negatively impacted by a number of prospects and customers either delaying their orders, or in some cases, reducing the size odf their orders late in the quarter. As a result of this revenue and EPS shortfall, we are lowering our rating on FileNet."
-- The analyst said he was awaiting more detail from the company before making any change in the earnings estimate.
